Detailed Description

The VAD Setting Interface.

VAD

Voice Activity Detection (VAD) is a technique to detect whether voice is active, and one of its goals is to DTX (Discontinue Transmition) to reduce traffic. There is a special packet named Silence Insertion Descriptor(SID) between voice and DTX packets, and it tells receiver DTX following SID.
Thus, a scenario may be 'voice ... voice SID DTX .... DTX voice'. This feature is related to codec, and support list is:

  • G.711: yes
  • G.722: yes
  • G.723: yes
  • G.726: yes
  • G.729: yes
  • GSM-FR: no
  • iLBC 20/30ms: no

Function Documentation

int32 rtk_SetThresholdVadCng ( int32  chid,
int32  mid,
int32  nThresVAD,
int32  nThresCNG,
int32  nModeSID,
int32  nLevelSID,
int32  nGainSID 
)

Set VAD/CNG threshold and SID noise level configuration.

The comfort noise payload, which is also known as a Silence Insertion Descriptor (SID) frame and the CN payload format are defined in RFC 3389.
VAD detects current voice energy to determine the SID noise level.

Parameters
chidThe channel number.
midThe media session number.
nThresVADVAD Threshold
nThresCNGCNG Threshold
nModeSIDSID Configuration Mode

SID Configuration Mode Index
Disable Configuration 0
Fixed noise level 1
Adjust noise level 2

Disable configuration: The SID noise level is determined by VAD.
Fixed noise level: The SID noise level is configured by user.
Adjust noise level: The SID noise level is determined by VAD and the user's settings.
nLevelSIDSID Noise Level (Available only when the nModeSID=1)
Available range: 0~127 (0dBoV ~ -127dBoVm, 0dBov is maximum value).
Unit: dBoV
nGainSIDSID Gain Adjustment (Available only when the nModeSID=2)
Available range: +127~-127, 0(not change), the positive/negative value is gain up/down.
Unit: dBoV
Return values
0Success
int32 rtk_SetSilenceDetThreshold ( uint32  chid,
uint32  energy,
uint32  period 
)

Set silence detection threshold.

Parameters
chidThe channel number.
energySeen as silence if less than this energy.
Available range: 0 ~ 127 (indicates 0dB ~ -127dB)
Default: 55
Unit: dB
periodSilence period in unit of ms
Default: 10000
Note
It may be better to use (T.30 T2 = 6 +- 1 sec) as silence period.
Return values
0Success
